content: Is there an equivalent in Lean to Show Proof. in Coq? I am curious if we can check the abstract syntax tree of a proof?

If you have a theorem called thm_name you can do #print thm_name.

Within a proof, you can use by? instead of by to get it to print the term. You can also prefix tactics or terms with show_term.
Thanks! I got confused for a bit as it wasn't working but I think have to import Mathlib to use by? and show_term. (in case anyone else is reading this)
Jeremy Toh has marked this topic as resolved.
